means: 退职，退役， （使）退休( retire的现在分词 )

sentence.Network_en: Webster is retiring as head of the Central Intelligence Agency (CIA).
sentence.Network_cn: 韦伯斯特即将从中央情报局局长的位子上退职。

sentence.Network_en: I'm retiring next month. They're putting me out to pasture.
sentence.Network_cn: 我下个月退休。他们要我养老去了。

sentence.Network_en: Lillee said he had no regrets about retiring.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 英语学习--我是北方的云的blog ... retired adj. 已经退休 retiring adj. 即将退休 cost 售价.

shy; bashful; backward; coy; self... ... self-conscious 不自然的,忸怩的; retiring 腼腆的;谦让的; shy 害羞的.

entry.tran: 不爱交际的;害羞的;孤僻的;离群索居的
entry.def: Someone who is retiring is shy and avoids meeting other people.

example.ex: I'm still that shy, retiring little girl who was afraid to ask for sweets in the shop.
example.tran: 我仍然是那个羞怯孤僻，不敢在商店买糖果的小女孩。

means.word_mean: 1. not blatant or overly aggressive in manner or appearance;
2. moving toward a position farther from the front;

sentences.sentence: "the receding glaciers of the last ice age"
"unassuming to a fault, skeptical about the value of his work"

means.word_mean: 4. of a person who has held and relinquished a position or office;

auth_sentence.content: Most of us are living longer and retiring later.
auth_sentence.res_content: Most of us are living longer and retiring later.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Most of us are living longer and retiring later.

auth_sentence.content: Most people used to pay off their debts before retiring.
auth_sentence.res_content: Most people used to pay off their debts before retiring.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Most people used to pay off their debts before retiring.

auth_sentence.content: Lenk will be replacing retiring justice Judith Cowin.
auth_sentence.res_content: Lenk will be replacing retiring justice Judith Cowin.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Lenk will be replacing retiring justice Judith Cowin.

Sentence.sentence: Yes, people are retiring even in this economy.

means.word_mean: 即将退休的，即将离职的，即将退役的

sentences.en: He must be getting near retiring age.
sentences.cn: 他一定快到退休年龄了。

sentences.en: He’s certainly got the right idea, retiring at 55.
sentences.cn: 他真的想通了,打算55岁就退休。

sentences.en: Her majesty awarded a distinction upon〔to〕 the retiring Prime Minister.
sentences.cn: 女王陛下授勋给行将离任的首相。

means.word_mean: 过隐居生活的,孤僻的;害羞的

sentences.en: He is a naturally shy, retiring man.
